thread.title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Winners named at the second North East Business Awards regional heat
thread.title_full: Business Breakfast LIVE: Winners named at the second North East Business Awards regional heat

author: Coreena Ford
title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Winners named at the second North East Business Awards regional heat
text:
Job vacancy levels hit seven-year high 
A leading employment group has reported the highest number of job vacancies for seven years. 
Reed said almost 250,000 jobs were on its site last month, an increase of 7% on a year ago, with big rises for work in health, manufacturing and consultancy as well as among charities and voluntary groups. 
The biggest increases were in Northern Ireland, Wales and the North East, said the report, which follows yesterday’s official figures showing record employment of almost 32 million. 
Reed chairman James Reed said the figures showed that the UK’s “charge” towards full employment continues, but he warned that clarity was needed over the rights of EU citizens. 
“With high employment and such a large number of opportunities on offer, the UK jobs market has turned into a sellers’ market. 
This means that jobseekers in many sectors can afford to be selective. 
“If candidates from the EU are put off from applying for jobs in the UK due to Brexit or the lack of a guarantee of EU citizens’ rights to stay in the UK after Brexit, then the scales could tip even further.” 8.20 KEY EVENT Durham, Sunderland and South Tyneside Company of the Year - were you there? 
Whether you were at the Ramside Hall do or not, this is a one-stop shop for everything that happened last night. 
If you were there, our photographer Iain Buist might well have taken your pic, which you can find in our gallery. 
And you can read how the whole night unfolded here, in the recap of the special blog we ran during proceedings. 
My fellow colleagues Graeme Whitfield, the business editor, and Jonny Manning, business reporter, also took part in that blog - and one of these events has surely got to see our #businesspuddings start to trend! If you’re at the regional heat on Teesside, or at the grand final, be sure to join in...please... Dave Crone of Omega Plastics Group, Company of the Year Winner (Photo: Newcastle Journal) 8.10 KEY EVENT Omega Plastics named the Durham, Sunderland and South Tyneside Company of the Year 
It’s the morning after the night before - the Durham, Sunderland and South Tyneside heat of the North East Business Awards. 
And what a night it was for Omega Plastics, which triumphed as Company of the Year, topping a brilliant 12 months in which it continued its dizzying growth trajectory. 
The Washington-based firm, which also has sites in Blyth and Hartlepool, was the big winner on a night of celebration at Sunderland’s Stadium of Light. 
Also picking up prizes at the sell-out event were former winners Redu and Vic Young, while Sunderland’s Maxim Facilities Management were double winners after taking the Let’s Grow Award and the prize for Digital and Social Media. 
Hosted by BBC presenter Ingrid Hagemann, more than 350 people saw Omega beat CreateCity and Home Instead Senior Care Durham to the top prize. 
Before the prizegiving, guests at the ceremony had heard from Sunderland AFC legends Jimmy Montgomery and Kevin Ball, while Bob Cuffe, North East managing director for The Journal’s owners, Trinity Mirror, delivered the keynote speech at the start of proceedings. Share
